content.user_title: Apply causal reasoning to business decisions
content.value_statement: Make evidence-based decisions through a systematic 6-stage workflow. Start with factual observations, test hypotheses, quantify impact, commit to action, execute tasks, and capture learning.

prompt_templates.title: Start decision thread
prompt_templates.prompt: Start a new causal reasoning thread for [situation]. Create thread structure and document Stage 1: Input with factual observation, source, date, and context.

prompt_templates.title: Analyze hypothesis
prompt_templates.prompt: For thread [thread-name], complete Stage 2: Hypothesis. Identify which Canvas assumptions are challenged or validated. Set confidence levels and identify Canvas sections to update.

prompt_templates.title: Quantify impact
prompt_templates.prompt: Complete Stage 3: Implication for thread [thread-name]. Quantify revenue opportunity, costs, ROI, timeline, and risk. Classify as low/medium/high/critical impact.

prompt_templates.title: Make commitment
prompt_templates.prompt: Complete Stage 4: Decision for thread [thread-name]. Document decision statement, alternatives considered, success metrics, and calculate impact score. Determine if human review required.

output_examples.input: Start a causal thread for three enterprise customers requesting a premium tier product with $400K-600K budgets
output: Stage 1 Input documented with factual observations
Context captured: current co-branded offering only

best_practices: Start each thread with factual observations only, no interpretation or solutions
Link every hypothesis to specific Canvas assumption IDs for traceability
Calculate impact scores using formula: (Revenue Ã— 0.4) + (Strategic Ã— 0.3) + (Risk Ã— 0.2) + (Urgency Ã— 0.1)
Complete Stage 6 Learning to auto-update Canvas with validated evidence
anti_patterns: Skipping stages or making decisions without completing the 6-stage flow
Including solutions or recommendations in Stage 1 Input
Failing to update Canvas after Stage 6 Learning

faq.question: What tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Works with any AI that can follow structured reasoning workflows.

faq.question: What impact scores require human review?
faq.answer: Scores 0.7 or higher require human review. AI has full autonomy for scores below 0.7 when ROI exceeds 3x and risk is low-medium.

faq.question: How does it integrate with other skills?
faq.answer: Links to goal-tracker for goal state updates. Reads Canvas assumptions for hypothesis validation. Spawns sales, marketing, or engineering threads for execution.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Pure prompt-based skill with no data collection. All data stays within your AI session. No external network calls or file system access.

faq.question: Why is my thread stuck?
faq.answer: Check that each stage produces required outputs. Stage 1 needs facts, Stage 2 needs assumption links, Stage 3 needs numbers, Stage 4 needs decision. Complete all gates before proceeding.

faq.question: How is this different from other reasoning skills?
faq.answer: Reasoning-causal uses structured 6-stage flow for known processes with clear cause-effect. Use abductive for diagnosis (why X happened) or inductive for pattern detection from data.
